title: South west Wales father convicted of raping daughter after fathering at least six of her children
text:
A father has been found guilty of rape after fathering 'at least six' of his daughter's children over a period of 20 years.

The man, who cannot be named in order to protect his victims, was also found guilty of raping one of the children he fathered with his daughter, and another of his daughters.

He denied 36 counts of rape, claiming the sex was consensual as he didn't know the teenage girl was his daughter.

A judge at Swansea Crown Court told the defendant, who is from south west Wales, his was one of the worst cases he had come across in 40 years.

A father from south west Wales has been found guilty of rape after fathering 'at least six' of his daughter's children at Swansea Crown Court (pictured)

The prosecution said he used elements of witchcraft and the occult to manipulate his victims, including creating a fake mystic who told the females to perform sex acts on him.

When he gave evidence in his defence, he said the sexual relationship with the female began when she was aged 14.

He said this was the start of her blackmailing him into a sexual relationship that he had not wanted.

He told the court he did not know at the time that the teenager was his biological daughter, but accepted that 'everybody believed I was'.

The jury took four hours and 23 minutes to find the man guilty on all 36 counts.

Judge Paul Thomas told the jury: 'I have been involved in criminal cases as a barrister and as a judge for 40 years.

'This is in the top three worst cases I have ever had to deal with. I'm used to it, but for you to have to listen to this sort of evidence must have been a difficult experience. I can only thank you for doing your duty.'

Telling him he should expect years behind bars, he said: 'You will not be surprised to hear a very long prison sentence awaits you.'

The defendant did not speak in response and has been remanded in custody.
